attributes.action: Make Airlines include 'ONE' 20kg Case in Ticket Prices.
attributes.additional_details:
A few years ago Airlines used common sense and so included a Case per Ticket, now they rip their passengers off through the backdoor with Add ons, some charge around £30 to £45 per small case per person which adds a large amount to a family Holiday.

Airlines 'Use' this practice a great deal by seat charges, meals, legroom.

Yes it goes on weight of the Plane, but when you consider that most people are mainly slim with a few large they must know the weight on a full plane of just passengers.
attributes.background:
As most people take Cases with them for Holidays with Children it is common sense that they need Clothes to take with them, Airlines should now this instead of a backdoor money making scheme as now, they should price Tickets with the above included as it used to be.
Stop ripping the Holiday maker.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. As airlines are private companies, this is an operational decision for them and not the UK Government and Parliament.
